page.title: 01General View, North Alcester
page.content: This area is rural, a rolling landscape made up of small, hedged fields and patches of woodland. Two rivers, the Arrow and Alne, flow from North and East and meet in Alcester on their way to the Avon. There are several isolated farms, 3 villages - Great Alne, Coughton and King's Coughton - and a fast-growing residential area north of Alcester. Employment opportunities in this area are to be found on the Arden Forest Industrial Estate. The area's beautiful, rural setting offers recreational facilities such as walking, riding and fishing. For tourists there are the N.T. properties: Kinwarton Dovecote and Coughton Court with its ford. Churches at Coughton(2), Great Alne & Kinwarton are of interest to casual visitors.
